name: Hotel de Latour Maubourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel in a great location where we were handy to transport and attractions but still amongst local cafes and family-run restaurants, and for us Hotel Latour Maubourg ticked all the boxes. We liked its small size and the slight quirkiness of the rooms and decor. It felt decidedly French! The staff were absolutely lovely and always helpful and obliging. Rooms were cleaned daily, towels and amenities replaced and the bed was turned down in the evening, complete with sweets left on the pillows! Our room included a minibar and tea and coffee making facilities as well. Only downside was that the room was quite dark, with heavy drapes and not much natural light, but in a building of this age and style it is probably quite typical. Having a metro station directly across the road made transport very accessible, but we found we hardly needed it because so much was already within easy walking distance. Special thanks to Sylvia at reception for her tips on good cafes and eateries. We would definitely be happy for a return visit.
reviews.title: Location location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here just before christmas and it was a lovely hotel. staff were all lovely and polite and would do anything they could to help! short distance from anything you need in paris, couldnt be closer to the trains.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Avoid the restaurant/cafe next door, its over priced and the food was awful!
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights end of April. We had a lovely stay. The hotel is perfectly located to explore Paris. The staff were friendly and helpful. We have already discussed going back with the children next time. We were on the top floor and although the room was small, it had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Lost its Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past 6 years and just returned from a stay there. Sadly, the hotel has become very expensive (almost $300/night for a small single room and no breakfast included) and is beginning to show signs of wear (chipping paint, water stains on walls and ceiling around window). I used to love this hotel but I can't justify the cost for what you get.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Latour Maubourg for 2 nights at the start of July 2013. We booked an Empire Room and ended up in room #2 - Eugenie. The rooms was very spacious, with a huge comfortable bed, television, mini-bar, table and chairs, and desk. Temperatures were hitting 28 degrees C in Paris and the room was always lovely and cool with the air conditioning.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bathroom was luxuriously decorated, with a beautiful roll-top bath. This, however, caused a slight problem when showering, as the bath was not sealed to the wall meaning water would run down the wall, soaking the floor tiles and bath mat. A tiny issue however.
reviews.title: Decent boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were all friendly and spoke good English - certainly better than my French! -and were happy to hold on to our luggage both when we arrived early for check-in, and also at check-out. There is a laptop downstairs connected to wi-fi, and the rooms have free wi-fi connectivity.
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect, literally across the street from the Metro, and 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and the impressive Pont Alexandre III. There are a few nice restaurants 2 or 3 doors away, as well as a small supermarket in the next street.
reviews.title: Overall very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in July and it was fine. The first 2 nights were in a room that was very small, though comfortable and with a king-size bed. The last night we had another room that was large by Paris standards and with huge bathroom though for an extra euro100 per night (the bathroom even hosted a stepping machine - good for burning off wonderful French cuisine?) I would certainly opt for the larger room as it had small balconies by the windows and a view of the park. The staff are wonderful and even moved our 3 large suitcases for me when we changed rooms. Very helpful and caring. We normally like to stay in the Les Halles area of Paris however the hotel was close to Musee d'Orsay and the Eiffel Tower so it was well located and a pleasant walk to Galleries Lafayett (the sales were on!!!).
reviews.title: True Parisian vibe!!!! Felt very authentic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We CAN NOT SAY enough nice things about this boutique hotel. We stayed weekend of May 10-13!!!The lady at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. The room was efficient, VERY CLEAN and beautifully decorated on the first floor:-). The shower is fabulous! The location is super, 10 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower, across street from Metro and 15 minutes walk to Champs Elysees!!!!!!! For us, as a newly wed this hotel was very cozy and romantic! Hotels in Paris are expensive. But this hotel is certainly worth the cost. We'd go back for sure. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!
reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was good. It was next to the Invalides and right across from a metro station, which is a decent location.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the room was extremely expensive, at over 220 Euros a night, and we were left feeling like it wasn't really worth the price. The hotel was nice, but it wasn't anything that special to justify the very high cost.
reviews.title: Good Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel!
reviews.title: Lovely friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful: you can walk to the eiffel tower in ten minutes; the metro station is just across the street.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 4 nights in this hotel on the last week of May and it was great. The past reviews about the great location are all true, next to the metro, cafes and places of interests. You can walk to the park to feed the pigeons while you were having breakfast. But on our last day when we check-out, we do not get any help in bringing down our bags. We need to check-out by 7.45 am to catch a 12 noon flight and there was no-one that can help. Sad, it would have get a Excellent Review.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We recently spent six nights at Hotel de Latour Maubourg, and found the service to be outstanding. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay in Paris. The rooms are great, location fabulous, straight across the road from the metro and walking distance to The Eiffel Tower.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at Hotel de Latour Maubourg. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpfull. Will definitely return when next we visit Paris. The location was ideal for our needs. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Thank you for a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Hotel de Latour Maubourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment my wife and I arrived at the front desk of the hotel, the staff went out of their way to make our stay special. Sylvia, Tania, and even the two weekend evening staffers helped us plan our days in Paris, including helping us obtain advance tickets to Versailles, as well as dinner reservations at great places (both well known and otherwise). Our room was small by US standards, but tastefully decorated. The location allowed us to walk to most major attractions, and we dined in some great restaurants in the light of the Eiffel tower at night, walking back to our hotel extremely contented. There's really no reason to say more, other than we had high expectations based on what we had read on Tripadvisor, and the hotel and its staff more than lived up to its billing.
reviews.title: Traditional appearance masks extraordinary service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is without contestation, a look on the map says it all. We stayed in the smallest classic rooms, which were very sweet and clean. Didn't take the breakfast, so can't attest to that. The hotel prices are the same as many other hotels in downtown Paris, even those much further away. The staff was very, very nice and helped us when we found ourselves stuck during a mass demonstration (May 26th, 2013), which shut down half of the city centre with us and the hotel inside. The staff searched for a solution while we were getting through the crowd and got us to the airport with time to spare instead of spending a lot of money for new tickets and hotels. Very grateful for that!! These are things that matter!! This is my resident hotel in Paris from now on.
reviews.title: Sweet hotel & staff/perfect location

description: The Hotel de LATOUR MAUBOURG is a charming little hotel of 17 rooms, individually decorated, housed in an ancient mansion rebuilt during the age of Napoleon III. Located between the Eiffel Tower and Saint Germain des Près area, this is the ideal base for all your stays in Paris with a metro line just in front who take to the Opera or Champs Elysées.
